# Chord: Major 7th in G# (Shape: E)

## About the Major 7th Chord in G# (Shape: E)
The G# Major 7th chord, also known as G#maj7, consists of the notes G#, B#, D# and F. In this chord, G# is the root note, B# is the third, D# is the fifth, and F is the major seventh. When played in the E shape (often referred to as the `E-shape barre chord`), the fingering involves barring across all strings at the 4th fret, with additional finger placements for the specific notes.

## Notes and Intervals in the G# Major 7th Chord (Shape: E)
- G# (root)
- B# (major third)
- D# (perfect fifth)
- F (major seventh)

The interval structure for the G#maj7 chord in the E shape is root, major third, perfect fifth, and major seventh.

## Musical Genre and Flavor
The G# Major 7th chord in the key of G# major or relative E# minor is commonly used in jazz, R&B, soul, and other genres that require smooth, sophisticated, and jazzy sounds. This chord conveys a sense of warmth, richness, and complex tonality, adding a touch of elegance and class to musical compositions.
